title: What should I write someone if I want to buy their land property? - Quora

response.answer_text: Do it the same I way I did. We have a place in Arkansas for hunting and riding ATVs. There was a 40ac section next to us and the owners lived in California (they had inherited it from their parents). i looked up the owner through the property tax records and sent them a letter explaining who i was, that I owned the property next to theirs and would like to purchase theirs if it was for sale. I told them how I was willing to pay $x per acre (recent sales price for similar land and i enclosed a copy of the sale). They accepted the offer and we completed the sale using a title attorney and overnight mail. I have found that a letter a nice letter with as much detail about you and saying why you want it goes a long way. If it is to build a log cabin, tell them. Tell them your intent with the land. If you start using formal language or get vague, they will throw away the letter.

Tell them you are simply interested in buying their land if they are interested now or at a later date When they call you: if they say not interested - ask them if they know someone that would interested and of not ask them to keep your name and address and express both interest and a sense of urgencyIf they say they are interest - ask th how much and pretend not to be too anxious or in a hurry so you can negotiate a better price
